comments.text:
STR

1) compose msg with attachment(s)
2) from attachment pane's whitespace context menu, try to attach your vCard (because that's where you attach everything)

Actual

- cannot attach "Personal Card (vCard)" from context menu (command is missing)
- this is counter-intuitive, because a vCard is an attachment, and we also list it in the "Attach" button's drop-down menu. All other options (file, web page) from that menu are included in the context menu, imo no reason to skip the vCard.

Expected
- include separator + "Personal Card (vCard)" at the end of respective context menu

The vCard isn't exactly an attachment to begin with. It doesn't show up in the attachment list (sending or receiving), which I think is the correct behavior. I think it would make more sense to move that item to the Options menu or something.

comments.raw_text:
No strong feelings about this.

I suppose it makes sense to have it on the attachment dropdown button, because the mental idea is to attach your card to the message. Technically and on the mental map, it's an attachment, notwithstanding that we don't list it in the main list (which I agree looks correct). I think the point of exposing it in the attachment dropdown button is to make per-message setting easier. Which is why I would not tuck it away under options (which otherwise would be a suitable place, near digital signatures), because it doesn't hurt in the button menu at all. Btw there's a more permanent setting for vCard in Account Settings.

I was just thinking in terms of menu consistency / completeness, but maybe it doesn't make sense to show vCard on attachment pane's context menus, because it will not appear there after attaching. So maybe we should just leave things as they are, and not be over-consistent.

I'm fine with closing this wfm if it's not needed or wanted.

comments.raw_text:
I think I'd want to ask some other people to see what they think (I don't use vCards). To me though, it seems more like a signature. To be fair, the account settings window says "Attach my vCard to messages", but it also says "Attach the signature from a file instead", and a signature definitely isn't an attachment.

Finally, as an added anecdote, I recall trying to test the "Attach a vCard" item in the composer once, and was really confused when clicking it appeared to do nothing (it actually added a check mark to the item). I was expecting a dialog to pop up similar to the attach file/page items. At least for me, having that under Options as "Send My vCard" would have been more intuitive. Now, it does sort of indicate this behavior by not ending in "...", but UIs aren't always 100% consistent with that convention, so I often second-guess myself in these cases.

Maybe for the time being, we should make this bug more general and just have it be about figuring out what the "Attach a vCard" UI should look like, and making it behave consistently.
